intro: Doliocarpus esmeraldae, commonly known as the Esmeraldas doliocarpus, is a rare tropical tree native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes species such as cashew and sumac. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by distinctive, woody fruits. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered.
